title: Victim identified in gunshot death
content:
Battle Creek police are continuing their investigation into the shooting death Sunday of Kayla Babick.
Babick, 24, died after being shot once in the torso in an upstairs bedroom of her home at 23 Highway St.
Police were called at 1:26 p.m. and said they found she had walked down to the living room where she collapsed. LifeCare paramedics attempted to revive her but she was pronounced dead at Bronson Battle Creek.
Officers said the woman was shot once with a .45 caliber handgun while her 25-year-old boyfriend was in the room. The gun was recovered in the house.
Detective Sgt. Troy Gilleylen said Monday detectives have not determined exactly what happened or how Babick was shot.
The boyfriend was interviewed Sunday afternoon and was cooperative, Gilleylen said. He was released later in the day and was not charged. Police have not released his name.
He had said the gun was on a bed when Babick laid on it and it discharged but police said details of the shooting have changed and they are continuing their investigation into exactly what happened.
An autopsy is expected Monday on the body of Babick.
Police said she and the man lived in the house with her two young children. They, along with two adults, were in the house at the time of the shooting but police believe Babick and her boyfriend were alone in the bedroom at the time of the shooting.
Gilleylen said they have not had any reports of domestic violence between the couple.
Contact Trace Christenson at 966-0685 or tchrist@battlecreekenquirer.com. Follow him on Twitter: @TSChristenson
